abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Project Completion Note
            (PCN) for the Semi-Mechanized Rainfed Agriculture Pilot
            Project (SMRAPP) in Somalia, for which credit was approved
            on March 31, 1987, and made effective on November 25, 1987.
            The credit was never formally closed because of the civil
            war in Somalia which forced project operations to be
            suspended. The objectives of SMRAPP were to: (i) further
            refine and improve Semi-Mechanized Rainfed Farming System
            (SMR) farming technology through on-site adaptive research
            and trials; (ii) develop an independent and self sustaining
            organizational structure to manage the SMR activities for
            replication elsewhere in Somalia; and (iii) within the pilot
            area, increase crop and livestock production and incomes.
            The major lessons learned over the short duration of project
            implementation are: (a) a centralized approach is likely to
            encounter difficulties in securing farmer participation;
            increased participation in selection of land for individual
            cultivation, and in planting decisions might generate a
            greater response; (b) the use of a menu of options in a
            pilot project of this nature might facilitate the
            identification of approaches most viable under local
            conditions; and (c) cost recovery may need to be phased in
            as the benefits of the technology are demonstrated.
